title: Alex Günsberg
text: I am a dedicated PhD Candidate in Finance at GSF—The Graduate School of Finance, affiliated with Hanken School of Economics. With a solid academic background and a passion for research, my focus lies in the intricate dynamics of Household Finance and the behaviors of credit markets, alongside an interest in Urban Economics. My research benefits hugely from the machine learning background I developed during my previous career.

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Teaching

Chairman for 42 B.Sc. Seminars
Grading +100 referee reports and seminar presentations

Mentee in Hanken’s Teacher Mentor Program, Pilot group (2022)

title: Alex Günsberg
text:
Personal life
Characterized by a relentless drive, hard work ethic, and a penchant for innovation, I bring a unique blend of experience and skills to my academic pursuits. Before pursuing my PhD, I honed my analytical abilities as a Data Scientist, became proficient in Python, and gained entrepreneurial experience.
Outside academia, I’m family-centric and maintain a balanced lifestyle, enjoying activities like CrossFit and endurance sports. I am preparing for my first Ultra-cycling race this summer and have competed in a few ultra-trail running races.
